content:
How to do this example: x ∈ {a | a ∈ A ∩ B ∧ a ∈ C} → x ∈ A ∧ x ∈ B := ? I need this for some basic proof, but apply? or exact? did not help.

Also I am somewhat confused that inter_def is defined as x ∈ A ∩ B ↔ x ∈ A ∧ x ∈ B in the set theory game and as s₁ ∩ s₂ = {a | a ∈ s₁ ∧ a ∈ s₂} how can I get the former from the latter?
In mathlib, the theorem is probably called mem_inter or mem_inter_iff
The set builder notation is called setOf, so also look for mem_setOf
Thanks @Ruben Van de Velde ! Set.mem_setOf.mp is exactly what I needed :)
Philipp SL Schäfer has marked this topic as resolved.
